intro: Amygdalus serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated almond. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean region, characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in early spring, followed by almond-like fruits that contain edible seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens. The species is related to the common almond (Prunus dulcis) and shares similar botanical features.
